editorialSummary.text: Founded by an Olympic medalist, this studio provides fencing classes & lessons for kids & adults.

originalText.text: My daughter first attended Tim Morehouse Fencing Club for a summer camp and loved it. I was surprised when she requested to enroll for the fall session. She has been at the club for about 6 months now and seems to really enjoy it. She is a tough 8-year old to impress, so I am happy when she is eager to go to class twice each week. I am especially impressed with Coach Luka, who is extremely positive and enthusiastic with her. He sends emails and texts updating me about her progress and his positive demeanor really encourages her to try best. I am happy to see my daughter enjoy an activity that is both physically and mentally challenging in a supportive environment.

text.text: My daughter first attended Tim Morehouse Fencing Club for a summer camp and loved it. I was surprised when she requested to enroll for the fall session. She has been at the club for about 6 months now and seems to really enjoy it. She is a tough 8-year old to impress, so I am happy when she is eager to go to class twice each week. I am especially impressed with Coach Luka, who is extremely positive and enthusiastic with her. He sends emails and texts updating me about her progress and his positive demeanor really encourages her to try best. I am happy to see my daughter enjoy an activity that is both physically and mentally challenging in a supportive environment.

originalText.text: My son Timmy, who is now 8, has been taking fencing lessons here for the last year, and he has had a great experience.  He loves to come to practice, and has had the opportunity to fence in a few tournaments.  As a parent, it's really fun to see him learn to enjoy the sport and get better.  All of the coaches have been very supportive and encouraging.  My son has had one-on-one lessons primarily with Coach Melvin Rodriguez who has been great - his love both for teaching and fencing are really evident when he is working with the kids.  Lastly, one bonus which I didn't anticipate, is that I've really enjoyed getting to know the other families of the kids who fence at TMFC.  As a parent who didn't fence himself, and whose child is just starting out, the parents whose children are more advanced have been great about showing us the ropes and explaining how things work, and the whole community has been very friendly and supportive.

originalText.text: We think very highly of Tim Morehouse Fencing Club. Our son has been attending their Youth classes (2 group lessons, 1 private lesson per week) for the past several months and is enjoying it. The coaches take a real interest in each child and ensure that they understand the various technical aspects of fencing. The club also facilitates competitions that are helpful as your child gains the requisite skills. Our son takes lessons with Luka who is great and very responsive.

originalText.text: My son has developed really strong, positive relationships with his coaches and peers, and it has brought so much positivity into his life. The sport is challenging but also has a super supportive vibe around it. He’s made so many new friends and he really looks up to the coaches and all the staff. It’s a really nice bunch of people running this club who truly care about their students. I always feel safe leaving my son here and I know he’s in good hands. Great job you guys.

originalText.text: We found Tim Morehouse Fencing Club through Groupon of all things! And what find it has been. My daughter has been taking classes at the UWS club for over a year now and she/we couldn't be happier. She has found something that is her own and just so unique. I do think this a true testament to just what a fantastic environment Tim has created in his club, for the kids, and for the coaches. It's fast, it's determined, and it's fun most of all. I can recommend this sport and club to anyone. There's a certain type of magic that happens inside those walls.
